item.title: Why Certified VMware Pros Are Driving the Future of IT
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by VMUG
item.description: From hybrid cloud to AI, IT complexity and security risks are accelerating. Certified VMware pros bring clarity and resilience that keep teams ahead. See why CIOs are making certification a workforce strategy with VMUG. [...]

item.title: FBI warns of Russian hackers exploiting 7-year-old Cisco flaw
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has warned that hackers linked to Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) are targeting critical infrastructure organizations in attacks exploiting a 7-year-old vulnerability in Cisco devices. [...]

item.title: Scattered Spider hacker gets sentenced to 10 years in prison
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Noah Michael Urban, a key member of the Scattered Spider cybercrime collective, was sentenced to 10 years in prison on Wednesday after pleading guilty to charges of wire fraud and conspiracy in April. [...]

item.title: Orange Belgium discloses data breach impacting 850,000 customers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Orange Belgium, a subsidiary of telecommunications giant Orange Group, disclosed on Wednesday that attackers who breached its systems in July have stolen the data of approximately 850,000 customers. [...]

item.title: OpenAI says GPT-6 is coming and it'll be better than GPT-5 (obviously)
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI's CEO Sam Altman told reporters that GPT-6 is already in the works, and it'll not take as long as GPT-5. [...]

item.title: AI website builder Lovable increasingly abused for malicious activity
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Cybercriminals are increasingly abusing the AI-powered Lovable website creation and hosting platform to generate phishing pages, malware-dropping portals, and various fraudulent websites. [...]

item.title: Apple fixes new zero-day flaw exploited in targeted attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Apple has released emergency updates to patch another zero-day vulnerability that was exploited in an "extremely sophisticated attack." [...]

item.title: “Rapper Bot” malware seized, alleged developer identified and charged
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. Department of Justice (DoJ) announced charges against the alleged developer and administrator of the "Rapper Bot" DDoS-for-hire botnet. [...]

item.title: Perplexity’s Comet AI browser tricked into buying fake items online
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A study looking into agentic AI browsers has found that these emerging tools are vulnerable to both new and old schemes that could make them interact with malicious pages and prompts. [...]

item.title: Hackers steal Microsoft logins using legitimate ADFS redirects
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: Hackers are using a novel technique that combines legitimate office.com links with Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS) to redirect users to a phishing page that steals Microsoft 365 logins. [...]

item.title: Major password managers can leak logins in clickjacking attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Six major password managers with tens of millions of users are currently vulnerable to unpatched clickjacking flaws that could allow attackers to steal account credentials, 2FA codes, and credit card details. [...]

item.title: Microsoft investigates outage impacting Copilot, Office.com
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is investigating an ongoing issue preventing users across North America from accessing Office.com and the company's Copilot AI-powered assistant. [...]

item.title: Why email security needs its EDR moment to move beyond prevention
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Material Security
item.description: Email security is stuck where antivirus was a decade ago—focused only on prevention. Learn from Material Security why it's time for an "EDR for email" mindset: visibility, post-compromise controls, and SaaS-wide protection. [...]
